intro: Genista sandrasica, commonly known as the sandrasica broom, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Genista sandrasica is often used in landscaping for its hardiness and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
